text: The data set contains a list of more that 100,000 copies of video games, from the time period of 1983 - 2012.

title: BCB 520 - Project File
text: The data set contains a list of more that 100,000 copies of video games, from the time period of 1983 - 2012.

title: BCB 520 - Project File
text:
DATA COLLECTION
The following data was gathered through an internet search, where the data is open to the public. The data contains the rank of overall sales, game title, platform of the video game release, year of game release, genre of the game, publisher of game, and sales in the millions for US, Europe, Japan, rest of world wide and total global sales.

title: BCB 520 - Project File
text: The data set contains a list of more that 100,000 copies of video games, from the time period of 1983 - 2012.

title: BCB 520 - Project File
text: The data set contains a list of more that 100,000 copies of video games, from the time period of 1983 - 2012.

title: BCB 520 - Project File
text:
DATA COLLECTION
The following data was gathered through an internet search, where the data is open to the public. The data contains the rank of overall sales, game title, platform of the video game release, year of game release, genre of the game, publisher of game, and sales in the millions for US, Europe, Japan, rest of world wide and total global sales.

Data Set Type

Flat Table - Video Games Sales
We have a Flat Table, the items are the rows, wherein each row is the different types of games that has been released from 1983 - 2012. Each item (games) is described by attributes, which are put in columns. Those attributes represent: index, rank, game title, platform, year, genre, publisher, US, Europe, Japan, Rest of the Word, Global (total of sales), and reviews. For each column of the different countries represent the total sales from each one in terms of millions in sales.


Code
library(readxl)
my_df <- read_excel("Video Games Sales.xlsx")
knitr::kable(head(my_df,10))

title: BCB 520 - Project File
text:
ATTRIBUTE TYPES

Categorical: game title, platform, year, genre, publisher
Ordinal: Index, ranking
Quantitative: US (sales in millions), Europe (sales in millions), Japan (sales in millions), rest of the word (sales in millions), global (sales in millions), reviews in the sales

title: BCB 520 - Project File
section: WHAT DO I WANT FROM THIS DATA?
text:
WHAT DO I WANT FROM THIS DATA?

What was the highest video game sale from each country?
What was the most popular console (platform) for each country?
Which of the genres are most or/and less popular for each region?

title: BCB 520 - Project File
text:
TASK ABSTRACTION

Bar Graph
This first graph shows the distribution of game genre across the 100,000 game titles from 1983-2012. We have approximately 300 game titles in the sports. In close second is action and third shooter.


Code
title_genre<-my_df%>%
  select(Genre,`Game Title`)%>%
  group_by(Genre, `Game Title`)%>%
  summarise(count=n_distinct('Game Title'))%>%
  group_by(Genre) %>%
  summarise(TotalCount = sum(count))


`summarise()` has grouped output by 'Genre'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.


Code
library(ggplot2)

title_genre$Genre <- reorder(title_genre$Genre, title_genre$TotalCount)

ggplot(data = title_genre, aes(x = Genre, y = TotalCount, fill = Genre)) +
  geom_col(color = "black", width = 0.7) +
  ggtitle("Genre Distribution") +
  xlab("Genre") +
  ylab("Game Titles") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))





This second graph shows the platform (game console) distribution across the 100,000 game titles from 1983-2012. We have approximately more than 300 games titles for the PS2 console, in second is PS, and third XBOX 360.


Code
ggplot(my_df, aes(x = Platform, fill = Platform)) +
  geom_bar(color = "black", width = 0.7) +
  ggtitle("Platform Distribution") +
  xlab("Platform") +
  ylab("Game Titles") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))







Scatter Plot


Code
ggplot(my_df, aes(x = Platform, y = 'North America')) +
  geom_point(color = "darkblue") +
  ggtitle("Scatter Plot: Platform vs. North America") +
  xlab("Platform") +
  ylab("North America") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
        axis.title.x = element_text(margin = margin(t = 10)))  







Code
ggplot(my_df, aes(x = Platform, y = Japan)) +
  geom_point(color = "orange") +
  ggtitle("Scatter Plot: Platform vs. Japan") +
  xlab("Platform") +
  ylab("Japan") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
        axis.title.x = element_text(margin = margin(t = 10)))  







Code
ggplot(my_df, aes(x = Platform, y = Europe)) +
  geom_point(color = "purple") +
  ggtitle("Scatter Plot: Platform vs. Europe") +
  xlab("Platform") +
  ylab("Europe") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
        axis.title.x = element_text(margin = margin(t = 10)))

title: ASSIGNMENT 4
text:
DATA COLLECTION
The following data was gathered through an internet search, where the data is open to the public. The data contains the rank of overall sales, game title, platform of the video game release, year of game release, genre of the game, publisher of game, and sales in the millions for US, Europe, Japan, rest of world wide and total global sales.

title: ASSIGNMENT 4
text:
ATTRIBUTE TYPES

Categorical: game title, platform, year, genre, publisher
Ordinal: Index, ranking
Quantitative: US (sales in millions), Europe (sales in millions), Japan (sales in millions), rest of the word (sales in millions), global (sales in millions), reviews in the sales

title: ASSIGNMENT 4
text:
TASK ABSTRACTION

Bar Graph
This first graph shows the distribution of game genre across the 100,000 game titles from 1983-2012. We have approximately 300 game titles in the sports. In close second is action and third shooter.


Code
title_genre<-my_df%>%
  select(Genre,`Game Title`)%>%
  group_by(Genre, `Game Title`)%>%
  summarise(count=n_distinct('Game Title'))%>%
  group_by(Genre) %>%
  summarise(TotalCount = sum(count))


`summarise()` has grouped output by 'Genre'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.


Code
suppressMessages({itle_genre<-my_df%>%
  select(Genre,`Game Title`)%>%
  group_by(Genre, `Game Title`)%>%
  summarise(count=n_distinct('Game Title'))%>%
  group_by(Genre) %>%
  summarise(TotalCount = sum(count))})

library(ggplot2)

title_genre$Genre <- reorder(title_genre$Genre, title_genre$TotalCount)

ggplot(data = title_genre, aes(x = Genre, y = TotalCount, fill = Genre)) +
  geom_col(color = "black", width = 0.7) +
  ggtitle("Genre Distribution") +
  xlab("Genre") +
  ylab("Game Titles") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))





This Bar Graph provides a comparison between sales of different countries.


Code
library(ggplot2)

title_sales_Japan <- my_df %>%
  select(Genre, Japan) %>%
  group_by(Genre)

ggplot(data = title_sales_Japan, aes(x = Genre, y = Japan, fill = Genre)) +
  geom_col(color = "black", width = 0.7) +
  ggtitle("Japan Sales") +
  xlab("Genre") +
  ylab("Japan Sales") +
  scale_fill_viridis_d() +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))







Code
library(ggplot2)

title_sales_Europe <- my_df %>%
  select(Genre, Europe) %>%
  group_by(Genre)

ggplot(data = title_sales_Europe, aes(x = Genre, y = Europe, fill = Genre)) +
  geom_col(color = "black", width = 0.7) +
  ggtitle("Europe Sales") +
  xlab("Genre") +
  ylab("Europe Sales") +
  scale_fill_viridis_d() +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

title: BCB 520 - Project File
text:
DATA COLLECTION
The following data was gathered through an internet search, where the data is open to the public. The data contains the rank of overall sales, game title, platform of the video game release, year of game release, genre of the game, publisher of game, and sales in the millions for US, Europe, Japan, rest of world wide and total global sales.

Data Set Type

Flat Table - Video Games Sales
We have a Flat Table, the items are the rows, wherein each row is the different types of games that has been released from 1983 - 2012. Each item (games) is described by attributes, which are put in columns. Those attributes represent: index, rank, game title, platform, year, genre, publisher, US, Europe, Japan, Rest of the Word, Global (total of sales), and reviews. For each column of the different countries represent the total sales from each one in terms of millions in sales.

text:
TASK ABSTRACTION

Histogram Graph
This first graph shows the distribution of game genre across the 100,000 game titles from 1983-2012. We have approximately 300 game titles in the sports. In close second is action and third shooter.


Code

  select(Genre,`Game Title`)%>%

title: About
text: My name is Geraline Trossi-Torres, I’m a PhD student in Microbiology, Molecular Biology and Biochemistry at the University of Idaho. When not doing research I enjoy playing on my XBOX S or reading a good fantasy and Sci-fi books.

title: About
